snippet.title: Adele hosts Despicable Me 3 screening for Grenfell Tower survivors
snippet.content:
Grammy award-winner Adele has held a private movie night for young survivors of London's Grenfell Tower disaster. Since June's horrific blaze, which claimed at least 80 lives, the British singer to help those affected by the tragedy.

Dozens of residents joined Adele on Friday for a private screening of the animated film Despicable Me 3. Adele sees aiding her community as a full-time job now that her Live 2017 tour is over, according to The Sun.Photo: Jonathan Short "Being a local Londoner, she's made no secret about how personally affected she was by the Grenfell Tower blaze and wants to help in every way she can," a source told the newspaper. "While she's working hard behind the scenes to raise cash, she wanted to treat residents to a night of fun and help take their minds off what happened and organised a private viewing of the brand new Despicable Me 3 movie."
At least 80 people died when a fire broke out in the 24-storey West London building. Firefighters originally warned occupants to remain in their apartments, but improper cladding caused the fourth floor fire to accelerate alarmingly. A final death toll is not expected to be released until at least 2018, but around 255 people are said to have survived.Photo: AP Adele previously implored her fans to donate to her Grenfell Tower fund while performing at Wembley Stadium back in June. - Reuters
